intro: Adonis distorta, commonly known as the twisted bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its leaves are palmately divided, and the stems are often twisted, giving the plant its common name. Adonis distorta is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
